questions.question_text:
A company plans to migrate to Microsoft 365.

Firstline employees need to be able to collaborate by using Microsoft Yammer, SharePoint Online, and Teams. You must minimize costs.

Which subscription type should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
F3 license seems correct here.
Can't believe I paid money for this lmao. This is like the 30th question just blatantly labelled wrong. The answer is F3, nothing here requires desktop support.

Selected Answer: A
It's f3
F3 for me too

Selected Answer: A
This was previously answered in another question. Minimum cost is the goal, E3 provides more than needed at a higher cost

comments.content: According to the comparison table, there is no Teams in E3 or E5 or Office Subscriptions

f3 is right

A company is evaluating Microsoft 365.

You need to evaluate the licensing options available in Microsoft 365.

Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
yes, no, yes

Someone needs to re-go over these.

Microsoft Security Score measures an organization's security posture and provides recommendations for improving it. It does not offer real-time visibility or direct control over access or activities in cloud applications.

comments.content:
Correct.
Microsoft Secure Score is a measurement tool that provides recommendations for improving an organization's security posture. It does not provide real-time visibility or control over cloud app access or activities.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-xdr/microsoft-secure-score

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A company plans to implement Microsoft Defender XDR.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

Note: The question is included in a number of questions that depicts the identical set-up. However, every question has a distinctive result. Establish if the solution satisfies the requirements.
You have been tasked with deploying Microsoft Office to company using a subscription-based licensing model.
The version of Office you deploy should allow for Office application settings to be enforced via group policy.
Solution: You deploy Office Professional Plus 2016.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: “subscription-based” is the keyword here.
a subscription-based licensing model = CLOUD, and Office Professional 2016 is Not cloud. Then answer NO
B - "Baseado em assinatura" é a palavra-chave aqui.

O Office Professional Plus 2016 não é uma versão baseada em assinatura do Microsoft Office. Em vez disso, é uma versão tradicional do Office, que é vendida com uma licença perpétua e não está incluída em um modelo de licenciamento baseado em assinatura, como o Office 365 (agora conhecido como Microsoft 365). Para aplicar configurações do aplicativo do Office por meio de política de grupo, você precisaria de uma versão baseada em assinatura, como o Microsoft 365 Apps for Business ou Enterprise.

Portanto, a resposta correta é:

B. Não

Selected Answer: B
Only Office 365 ProPlus can be bought with subscription, other version of office, including the 2016 version can be bought only by license, so the answer is B.

Office Professional 2016 has a volume licensing and is not subscription based.

In software licensing, a volume licensing is the practice of selling a license authorizing one computer program to be used on a large number of computers or by a large number of users.
Office professional 2016 is not subscription based I guess...but it does allow for group policy..can someone confirm please?

Administrative Template files (ADMX/ADML) and Office Customization Tool for Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise, Office 2019, and Office 2016 : https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=49030
